summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing coordination between the 'Noel' case (involving deferred prosecution agreements) and the 'Epstein FOIA' litigation. It reveals internal strategy about court scheduling, ex parte submissions, and communication with The New York Times.

events.title: Internal strategy call on Noel/Epstein FOIA coordination
events.description: Prosecutors discussed the best course for updating the court in the Epstein FOIA case, considering the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case.

events.title: Follow-up on Noel status and court submission planning
events.description: Email chain continues discussing an unresolved issue requiring work from the 'Noel team', with anticipation of formal discussions with defense counsel by Friday.

events.title: Target date for in camera submission in Epstein FOIA
events.description: Prosecutors plan to submit materials for in camera review by the court in the Epstein FOIA case by this date, contingent on the status of the Noel deferred prosecution agreements.

locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, White Plains branch.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal DOJ coordination between the 'Noel' case (involving deferred prosecution agreements) and the Epstein FOIA litigation.
Prosecutors planned to submit an ex parte communication to the court about the Epstein FOIA schedule, flagging potential changes depending on the 'Noel' resolution.
The U.S. Attorney's Office intended to check with The New York Times about timing in the Epstein FOIA case without revealing substantive details.
All personal names and email addresses in the correspondence are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
The correspondence shows prosecutors managing court deadlines and external communications (with the court and the Times) based on the status of another case ('Noel').
